contentrichtext.text: '''LS''' may refer to: ;Companies * [[Lightspeed Media Corporation]], a collection of nude teen websites * [[LS Group]], a Korean company * LS, IATA code for [[Jet2.com]], a British airline ;Computers and electronics * [[ls]], a command specified by POSIX and the Single UNIX Specification * [[.ls]], the internet top-level domain for Lesotho * [[Link-state routing protocol]], used in packet-switching networks * LS, a low-power Schottky version of a [[7400 series]] chip ;Organizations * [[Liberal Party of Croatia]] * [[Lincoln-Sudbury Regional High School]], Massachusetts, USA * [[Lok Sabha]], lower house of the Parliament of India ;People * [[Larry Sanger]], co-founder of Wikipedia * [[Lady Sovereign]], British performance artist * [[Lemony Snicket]], author ;Places * [[Lesotho]], ISO 3166-1 country code * [[LS postcode area]], prefix of Leeds postcodes * LS, the code for County Laois, Ireland ;Automobiles * [[Lexus LS]], the flagship, full-size sedan made by Lexus * [[Lincoln LS]], a model of car made from 2000–2006 * [[GM LS engine]], V-8 engine in General Motors cars * a generic trim of [[Chevrolet]] vehicles. ; Transportation * [[Leading Seaman]], junior non-commissioned rank * [[LS 90]], continuous system, Czech and Slovak train protection system * LS, the prefix to the models of sailplane made by [[Rolladen-Schneider Flugzeugbau GmbH]] ;Science and medicine * [[Least squares]], regression analysis * [[Light-second]], a unit of length in astronomy * [[Local Supercluster]] (Virgo Supercluster), our galaxy supercluster * [[Angular momentum coupling#LS coupling|LS coupling]], interaction between quantum numbers * [[Pulmonary surfactant|Lung surfactant]], lipoprotein complex * [[Lichen sclerosus]], skin disease * [[Löwenheim–Skolem theorem]], a theorem in first-order logic dealing with the cardinality of models ; Latin * [[Lewis and Short]], Latin dictionary * [[List_of_Latin_phrases:_L|Lectori Salutem (L.S.)]], Latin for 'Greetings Reader' and used as opening words to a letter * ''locus sigilli'', Latin for 'place of the seal', used in notarized and legal documents; see: [[Seal (contract law)]] ; Music * "[[Lunar Strain]]" * "[[The Lightning Strike]]", a song by Snow Patrol ; Sports * [[Long snapper]], a special teams player in American football ; Games * [[Lost Souls (online game)|''Lost Souls'' (online game)]], a MUD, or text-based online role-playing game ;Other uses *[[Latvian lats]], currency of Latvia *[[Live sand]], a term used in aquarism, is sand populated with bacteria and organisms aiding in the dissolving of organic wastes *[[Logistics Specialist]], a rating in the United States Navy {{disambiguation}}
